alert.note: Alert for Northern Rocky Mountain Front (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued June 12 at 2:58AM MDT until June 15 at 6:00AM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM MONDAY TO 6 AM MDT WEDNESDAY FOR ELEVATIONS ABOVE 5000 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected for elevations above 5000 feet. Total snow accumulations between 2 and 8 inches from 5000 feet to 6000 feet, between 9 and 18 inches from 6000 feet to 7000 feet, and up to 24 inches above 7000 feet. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph. * WHERE...Northern Rocky Mountain Front. * WHEN...From 6 PM Monday to 6 AM MDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult over Marias Pass and other routes within or adjacent to Glacier National Park. Dangerous backcountry conditions will exist, especially for those recreating in the high country of Glacier National Park due to reduce visibility and raw conditions.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or visiting the MDT Road Report website.
